reviewText: This game is a blatant rip of HOMM5 graphically, but without the strategy. The gameplay is so boring that you have to pay (a lot) for the option to not do the battles. Those that have not paid up enough (it won't tell you how much) to reach VIP 4" actually have to watch the same boring battles over and over. Battles proceed on auto run so at least you can play another (real) game while this game runs.\n\nI did get to past L30 in order to see all of the content
date: but gameplay really doesn't improve later on. There are about 50 players in guilds on the one server. They are in 4 maxed out guilds (12 players each) and those are mostly non-English guilds. So you won't have any "grouping" options
recommended: not that this would make any difference. As in almost all Chinese MMORPG's
hoursPlayed: you "win" the game by spending more real money on avatars than your opponents. At "VIP 10" you get an orange con avatar which puts the game in easy mode. I would assume this costs $5000+."
voteText: August 15, 2015

reviewText: This game is even worse that the reviews make it sound.  It's not *just* a flash game running on Steam, or badly translated from whatever, or nakedly stealing from Heroes of Might and Magic 5; it's doing all of them, constantly, while bizarre, disconnected sound effects play for no reason.  I'd almost recommend it for its sheer traffic accident factor, but no.  It's just terrible.

reviewText:
I love this type of step by step strategy games and this is sort of a combination of Travian and Might & Magick in its simplest form. If you enjoy this type of games and you dont have a good pc then why not? Its free and its pretty interestign if you go all into it. If you count it as an online free to play game then yeah its probably okayish but if you view it as a game of High standart then I doubt its one of those.
It weights 121 kb - as of what it showed while it was in the downloading stage, it loads the stuff as you play it.

If I didnt had anythign else to play, then I would play it but we are not in the 2000 and steam has veriety of awesome games of better quality and this game was intended for online (browser) so I wouldn't really recomnd it as an awesome game you should really invest a huge amount of time in it.

Also for first 3-5 battles it was on auto-battle so I was like wtf do I even do if it auto-plays for me?"
It has a well made tutorial/tips of what does what and how it all works just as all other web-browser games."

reviewText:
PAY2WIN ALERT
Heroes of Might and Magic 5 online is a very boring game with very little to actually 'do' except watch timers, as usual.
Why am I calling this game by a different name? Well because they literally stole all the art assets from HoMM5 and made a game" out of them and when I say game what I mean is the usual tripe that passes as a pay2win game.

Interestingly this game actually shows you how much money people have spent in-game
date: the #1 player has so far spent $1700 and if you think he is an anomally
hoursPlayed: then you'd be wrong. So very
voteText: depressingly wrong. The other players from #2 to #10 have spent between $1400 to $700 respectively.\n\nNow I don't care if you find this game fun
helpfulPercent: so much fun you want to spend money on it. Capitalist Clicker taught me that people will spend money to receive literally nothing except numbers on a screen. Sometimes
votesHelpful: for even less than that.\n\nSo this review is for those of you who love seeing numbers and will spend money to make the numbers go bigger. Everyone else
votesTotal:
the review is done here. Heroes of Might and Magic online is a better game and that one is ♥♥♥♥ poor as well. Go enjoy something fun.

Still with me money crowd? Let's begin.
When you spend the real money for the fake money this game knows how to treat your wallet right. It has the VIP system that gives you more bonuses the more money you spend. It also has cashback
votesFunny: so you get back more money the more you spend. It has events every 2weeks that you can spend money on. The game shows who the biggest spender is
commentsCount: so you can compete to see who has spent the most! Combat is a let down
column16: there is no PvP for you to throw your wallet at other players with because the AI handles it all. I miss the days of being able to call non-cash spending plebs "casual". The cash shop incentives are really quite good as well as they make sure that you won't be bothered by the poor♥♥♥♥ because they provide daily bonuses to thank you for your patronage.\n\nI think thats about it
column17:
really. Sorry its such a mess but think of it as a massive list of numbers and you'll suddenly get a throbbing erection.

I recommend this game for people with money.
Poor people need not apply. Ever
column18:

reviewText: This is another Kuuplay game made from stolen material. This is their 5th game in this last year to be based on borrowed assets/engines (FireWill, Magic Barrage, Wrath of Athena, Reckless Ruckuss, and now Shadows of Kingdoms). They post under a few different publisher names, but it's the same group of Copy/Pasters. It's unethical behavior, shameless, and the games are just dull and bad. Check out the review of it here if you're still looking to play... https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7t1vggy7hpg

reviewText: I cannot imagine a single person who will enjoy this game, when it is clearly an imitation of more refined projects. I felt as stupid as a moribund cow playing Shadow of Kingdoms. It’s an embarrassment, and I will drown myself in clear poison to self-induce amnesia and forget its existence. Shadow of Kingdoms’ combat is utterly boring and without merit, an insult to mechanics championed by the Heroes of Might and Magic series. Avoid the nausea of a  Sartrean existential crises and pass on playing Shadow of Kingdoms.\n\n-See the full review at MMOs.com ^_^

reviewText:
The Video is a Let's play Gameplay Review that shows different features and gameplay aswell as the styles that the game has to offer, i.e building upgrades, army, battles, exploring and dungeons ect. If you're unsure about this game watching the video will surely help you decide! I as for one, love it so far and will continue to keep playing!

Pro's:
* Long gameplay to keep you hooked
* Real Time reward system that gives you materials, items, equipment, gold for time playing ex. 10 minutes of gameplay = 10K gold ect.
*Daily events and Missions
*Different dungeons and bosses
*Alot of activites to keep you busy
*Castle upgrades, you can upgrade your defences, i'm only around level 11 at the moment, unsure if that would be from other players that attack you or NPC's
*Multiple types of creatures/enemies
*Treasure hunting
*Army upgrades that allow you to have different types of troops/creatures in your squad.
*Visual upgrades based on level, i.e higher wall from level 1 - 2, guard towers, blacksmith, mage tower ect. cosmetic castle/land changes as you upgrade that provide bonuses.
*Every dungeon contains loot
*Treasure map dungeons contain armor/items to help your army
*Enemies are not too overpowered
*You may have an option at times if you are more powerful than an enemy you have a choice to too engage combat, due to fleeing foe.


Con's:
*Repetitive at times
*No Free roam
*Turn style combat, if you're not into that type of thing this game may not be for you
*Takes time for certain upgrades and elements
*Once your troops die, you cannot fight with your main character, the combat ends, you can choose to rematch if you wish.



What's up ladies and gentlemen! if you would like to see a reveiw based on current features and gameplay about Shadow Of Kingdoms you can find it here!: https://youtu.be/sziEk8IM5ws

reviewText: While this game is free to play, it is DEFINITELY a pay to win game. After a certain point, the receipt of lesser items, due to being a free player, and the limits on what magic you can study (random from any school, unless you are a paid player, and also buying gems to spend), leave you unable to stop people who do pay, from pretty much stomping you in PVP.
